prompt: Generate diverse and realistic customer feedback text that expresses negative sentiment. The feedback should convey dissatisfaction, frustration, or disappointment with a product, service, or experience. Include a wide range of contexts such as online shopping, restaurant visits, customer support interactions, app usage, travel experiences, or subscription services. Use varied tones (e.g., angry, sarcastic, disappointed, formal, passive-aggressive) and lengths (from short complaints to detailed critical reviews). Incorporate different perspectives, such as feedback from younger or older customers, or from different cultural backgrounds. Include subtle or nuanced negativity (e.g., mild frustration or polite criticism) alongside strong complaints. Examples could include criticism of poor quality, delays, unhelpful staff, technical issues, misleading advertising, or unpleasant experiences.
response:
I ordered a dress online and it arrived two sizes too small, now I’m stuck with it.  
The service at the restaurant was painfully slow, and the staff seemed completely uninterested.  
I can’t believe I paid for a subscription that barely offers any new content each month.  
The flight was delayed for hours, and there was no communication from the airline.  
I tried using the app, but it crashed multiple times, making it impossible to complete my order.  
The product I received was nothing like what was advertised; I feel completely misled.  
I had to wait over 30 minutes just to get a drink order taken; very disappointing experience.  
I reached out to customer service, and they were more frustrating than helpful.  
The food was cold when it arrived, and the delivery driver didn’t even apologize.  
I expected better quality for the price; this feels like a total rip-off.  
The hotel room was not clean and had a strange odor; I won’t be returning.

The staff at the store were rude and seemed annoyed that I was asking questions.
